Beatriz previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other products needed in her tailoring business. Her earnings were a big help for her family’s personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Beatriz is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. She will use her business profits to sustain her daily needs. Beatriz looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She dreams that her business will continue to exist and hopes that her grandchildren will finish their studies. Beatriz meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials

loans.name: Mariama B.

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mariama. She is married to a petty trader and has two children, ages 20 and 23. Mariama supports three additional dependents living with her and takes care of them while they attend school in the city. She works producing different types of gara cloth such as clothing, bedding, and curtains. Mariama works six days a week, 10 hours a day and earns about 1,100,000 SLL each month.

Mariama is requesting a 3,000,000 SLL loan to buy bales of brilliant material to produce different types of gara cloth, including clothing, bedding, and curtains. She has not yet opened a shop as she had planned but her children are now in college. Mariama thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of materials to produce different types of gara cloth.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 42 year old Adama. She is married with children ages 3, 10, 15, 17 and 21. Three of her children attend school. In 1998, Adama established a business selling groundnuts and clothing. She began her business because her father was against sending a girl child to school. Adama had wanted to have a good education but, without the support of her parents, she decided to engage in her mother's business. She works seven days a week and 10 hours each day to earn about 890,000 SLL every month.

Adama is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to purchase bags of groundnuts and ladies' wear. In the future, she plans to expand her business and help her husband to educate her children. Adama thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of groundnuts and ladies' wear

loans.name: Om-Mahmoud Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Mahmoud and consists of 3 female members who live in Aden, Yemen. This community is hardworking and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. 

Smara is the leader of the group. She is a 27 year old, married woman. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her family with a better future. She went through a lot of effort and had to save money with the help of her family to set up her small house. Now she has applied for a loan to buy construction supplies to complete her house. She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete her house.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe, a married woman of five, is an agriculturalist who does both animal rearing and crop farming. The farming helps to put food on the table for her and her family without spending and the cows produce milk. She sells the surplus to get income to pay for her children's tuition and buy their other basic needs. She will use the loan to buy young cows that she will graze and later sell when they have appreciated in value. Phoebe is hard working and thanks Kiva lenders for the opportunity to obtain a loan. In the photograph is Phoebe with the Ugafode credit officer (left-right) at her farm.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Olga Mery

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer amable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos por quienes lucha incansablemente para sacarlos adelante.
Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia como comerciante independiente, pues inició su propio negocio como alternativa para generar ingresos que le permitieran apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar; en el almacén de variedades ofrece utensilios de cocina, lociones, utensilios de aseo, entre otros, trabaja sola todos los días de la semana y así logra obtener los recursos para su familia.
El crédito lo solicita como apoyo para fortalecer sus inventarios, con el dinero comprará mercancía al por mayor (productos de aseo, utensilios de cocina, artículos para el hogar), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad para satisfacer las necesidades de sus compradores y así mejorar el nivel de ventas y ganancias.
De esta forma, Olga desea seguir luchando para acreditar y fortalecer su negocio y en un futuro a mediano plazo sueña con ampliarlo para tener mayor variedad de inventario y garantizar una rentabilidad favorable que le permita brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olga is a friendly and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and two children, and she works tirelessly to get them ahead.

She has more than 10 years experience as an independent businesswoman. She started her own business as an alternative to generate income that would allow her to share the household financial burden with her husband. In the variety store, she offers kitchen utensils, lotions and cleaning tools, among other things. She works alone every day of the week and thus manages to earn money for her family.

She is applying for the loan as backing to strengthen her inventory. With the money, she will buy wholesale merchandise (cleaning products, kitchen utensils, items for the home). This will allow her to offer a greater variety to satisfy the needs of her buyers and thus improve her level of sales and earnings.

In this way, Olga hopes to continue striving to validate and strengthen her business. In the medium term, she dreams of expanding it to have a greater variety of inventory and to guarantee a profitability that will allow her to provide her children with a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (cleaning products, kitchen utensils, items for the home).

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Due to the difficult circumstances under which she grew up, Adjoa did not have access to any type of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. She currently earns a living by selling kako (a local dish featuring salted cod) and other foodstuffs in the village of Besease. She has been in this line of work for the last four years, is married to a farmer and has two children. She believes that there is growing demand for her product, but she is unable to meet it because she has limited supplies. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to escape from poverty.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients.

loans.name: Yeabu S.

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Yeabu S.  She is single and has a 4-year-old child and a child who attends school. In 2006, Yeabu S. established her clothing business. She began her business when she was in college.  By doing this trade, she was able to pay for her fees and other school charges.  

After graduating, she continued with her trade since she could not find a job. This business is now her job and will help her generate income. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 660,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Yeabu S. requires a loan in order to purchase clothing. 

In the future, Yeabu S. plans to expand her business. Competition is high, but she is hardworking and determined. The loan will make a big change in her business.  She is looking forward to subsequent loans from ARD and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Even though Adjoa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She sells ‘sabo’ in Besease (near Elmina).  ‘Sabo’ is a traditional dish consisting of a mixture of maize and groundnuts (similar to peanuts) that is cooked and wrapped in corn husks. Adjoa is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Adjoa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of ‘sabo.’ In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels to sell greater quantities of ‘sabo’ (a traditional dish of maize and groundnuts).

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Jariatu. She is single but has a 6 year old child. In 2002, Jariatu established her commercial African cultural bead necklaces and anklets business. She began her business because of wanting to be productive and to be self-reliant. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

Jariatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more bead anklets and bracelets. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her profit by approximately SLL 500,000. In the future, Jariatu plans to establish her business in other places that lack such goods. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bead anklets and bracelets.

loans.name: Ayebi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ayebi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ayebi prepares and sells a variety of Ghanaian traditional dishes in Besease (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Ayebi is married to a farmer and has six children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Ayebi has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her products. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more ingredients for the food that she prepares. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ayebi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her food.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 24-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child, who is attending school. She is an ambitious woman who strives to work very hard just to provide her family with a sufficient income. Her work consists of selling traditional Lebanese clothing called “Aabaya”. She works from her home and from time to time she visits customers on her own to offer them her good-looking outfits. 

Today, Fatmeh seeks to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase more clothing items as she plans to increase her business sales and therefore her revenues. Fatmeh intends to improve the family’s way of living. She desires to have another baby but she must be capable financially before getting into this.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing items.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells ‘kako’, or salted fish, in Besease (near Elmina). She has been doing so for about twenty years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have six children. 

Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Mercy is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fabric and footwear in Besease (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for thirteen years. Mercy is single without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. 

Mercy wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fabric and footwear. In the long term, Mercy plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fabric and footwear.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi did not have any form of formal education but this has not stopped her from achieving her aim of receiving a better life. She sells smoked fish at Abura, Cape Coast. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes it for sale to individuals in her locality and also supplies it to others for resale. She has been involved in this business for ten years. 

Esi is married with three children.  The income from her business normally goes towards helping her husband (who works with the electricity company of Ghana) to pay her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her fish. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more fresh  fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity of education since she did not have that opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a small trader who sells crate of eggs at Abura, Cape Coast. She sells to individuals and also supplies to others for resale. She has no formal education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been selling eggs for four years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of eggs thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. Ama hopes to use the profits from her sales to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive quality education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of eggs thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia tiene 42 años, casada con 4 hijos que tienen la edad de 18, 15, 12 y 10 años y, ella trabaja como vendedora de jugos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la  localidad de Sacaba, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, la señora Patricia va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que esta solo con pozo y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua así que hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que La señora Patricia tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Patricia is 42 years old and married. She has four children aged 18, 15, 12 and 10 years. She works as a juice vendor at her sales booth which is located in the village of Sacaba. This is her first loan with the institution. Patricia will use this loan to finish setting up water facilities in her home, since she currently only has a well and it's a lot of work to carry the water from there. That's why she'll set up water hookups for the toilet, shower and kitchen, and thus she'll provide more comfort for her family. For several reasons, her area doesn't have basic utilities, but this shall not prevent Patricia from having clean water in her house. She feels very happy because of the opportunity she has been given to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to set up water facilities in her home.

loans.name: Alladin

texts.en:
Alladin is a retailer of local food supplements in Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in business for more than two years now. Alladin works hard to support the needs of his family, especially for the food. 

Alladin is asking for a loan to buy more food supplements to sell to his customers. With this loan, he will be able to sell more and augment his income. 

In the future, Alladin hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more food supplements to sell to his customers.

loans.name: José Aníbal

texts.es:
José, a sus 46 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente; inició con una tienda de abarrotes que administró durante 7 años y luego la vendió y compró una charcutería con billares, allí ofrece mecato, gaseosas, cervezas, licor, dulces, entre otros; cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado y ya lleva dos años en funcionamiento; así genera los recursos suficientes para su sustento. 
Actualmente requiere surtir su negocio con mayor variedad de productos, pues la demanda aumenta en la temporada decembrina, razón por la que solicita el apoyo del crédito, para comprar mecato, gaseosas, licores, cervezas, chicles, dulces, entre otros y, así satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus clientes; lo que le ayudará a mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio y sus ingresos.
José manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ver progresar su negocio, fortalecerlo y así posicionarlo aún más en el mercado, que la afluencia de personas sea constante y, que le garantice una rentabilidad favorable para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José at 46 works as an independent businessperson. He started with a grocery store that he ran during 7 years. Later he sold it and bought a deli with pool tables, offering pastries, soft drinks, beer, liquors, sweets, etc. He has the help of an employee who has worked there for two years. In this way he generates the resources he needs to live.

At this time he needs to stock his business with a greater variety of products as it is December and demand is higher. For this reason he has requested a loan to buy pastries, soft drinks, liquor, beer, Chiclets, candy, etc. to satisfy the varied tastes of his clients. This will boost the profitability of his business and his income. Jose expressed that his greatest dream is to see his business strengthen and progress to become better positioned in the market. He'd like to see a steady flow of people which would guarantee a favorable profit to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pastries, soft drinks, liquors, beer, Chiclets, candies, etc.

loans.name: Keila Esther

texts.es: Keila, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 2 hijos y reside  en el municipio de San Manuel, Cortes. Se dedica actualmente al negocio de venta de tortillas de maíz. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 8 meses, este mismo lo tiene ubicado en su casa. Ella  anteriormente trabajo en maquila. El préstamo que solicita es por 12,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la construcción de una pequeña galera para la hornilla donde hace las tortillas, con el propósito de mejorar el negocio y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Keila is 36 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship with her husband with whom she has two children. They live in the municipality of San Manuel, Cortes. She sells corn tortillas. She has had the business for 8 months and operates it at her house. Previously she worked in a factory.

Keila is requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL to invest in the construction of a small gallery for the grill where she makes her tortillas. This will improve her business and get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy material like wood, laminated sheeting,and nails to build a gallery for her business.

loans.name: Ufalme Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bagaza est une commerçante depuis 4 ans et membre d’une association d’affaires « Ufalme», âgée de 35 ans et mère des 6 enfants dont, 4 étudient et 2 sont encore gamins. Elle est vendeuse des articles divers et sociétaire d’une boutique. Elle étale ses marchandises à  son domicile sur la rue dans une avenue animée du Quartier. Elle sollicite un crédit  auprès de Hekima, pour accroitre son entreprise. Son conjoint est un enseignant. Elle va acheter 20 litres huiles, 1 sacs de farine formant, les allumettes, 1 carton de savons, un sac de sucre, des bonbons, biscuits, sel iodé, etc. Elle commença  avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique. Dans  photo du groupe, une cliente porte ses bébés.
texts.en:
Bagaza has been a trader for four years, and is a member of the business group 'Ufalme'.  She is thirty-five years old, and mother to six children.  Four of her children attend school, and the other two are too young.  Her husband is a teacher.  

Bagaza sells various products from a stall at her home, on a busy avenue.  She began her business with funds received from her husband.

She has requested a loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to improve her business.  She will buy twenty litres of oil, one sack of wheat flour, matches, one box of soaps, a sack of sugar, sweets, biscuits and iodized salt.

In the future, Bagaza would like to buy a plot of land and build a house.  She would also like to feed and educate her children.  

Bagaza thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

In the photo, one of the clients is holding her child.

loans.use: to buy 20 litres of oil, 1 sack of wheat flour, matches, 1 box of soaps, 1 sack of sugar, sweets, biscuits and iodized salt.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dorine Joelle

texts.fr: Dorine est une femme de 27 ans, célibataire. elle possède et gère un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans. afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des produits cosmétiques pour 300 000 francs. les produits générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Dorine is a 27-year old single woman. She owns  a beauty salon in one of the city neighborhoods and has been managing it for three years. In order to meet customer demand, she is applying for a loan to restock her merchandise buy purchasing cosmetic products for 300,000 West African francs. The resulting [revenues] will be reinvested in her business and allow her to provide for her household.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a farmer living in Eldoret, a fertile land for agriculture. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are of school-going age. Lucy has been farming for 22 years, producing and selling milk, eggs and maize. In farming, Lucy enjoys dairy farming and the part she loves most is milking the cows, but the challenge she faces is lack of enough animal feed during dry seasons.

Lucy said that she chose Juhyudi Kilimo for this loan because she needed an MFI that would enable her to improve her dairy farming. During the training, she learned how to develop a strict savings culture. Her greatest expense goes to school fees and this loan will boost her income because her dairy cows will produce more and thus increase her income base and allow her to pay her children's school fees. She will increase the food supply on her farm.

loans.use: get a dairy unit extension.

loans.name: Savet's Group

texts.en:
Savet is a villager from Sangke district in Battambang province. She is 46 years old and married with seven children, six of them are under her responsibility. To make a living, Savet and her husband have been rice farming. She has also worked as a paid worker for 11 years. These current businesses return her around 23,200 KHR per day. 

Savet is a past client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three times and she successfully paid back the loans which have helped her family’s condition improve. This is the fourth cycle for her. Savet leads the group of two. They are seeking a loan for 2,400,000 KHR to pay for reaping fees. She hopes to earn more income to make her standard of living better.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fees

loans.name: Luz Helena

texts.es:
Luz es una campesina de 44 años de edad, trabajadora y amable; vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos por quienes ha luchado incansablemente.
Desde que era muy pequeña, sus padres le enseñaron todas las tareas agropecuarias pues era la única alternativa de vida que tenían; gracias a esto, hoy en día se dedica a la cría y comercialización de pollos y cerdos, trabaja sola todos los días desde las primeras horas de la mañana y, la producción la vende en el mercado del municipio donde vive o entre los vecinos de la zona.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de pollos para engorde y concentrados para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá ampliar su capacidad de producción y podrá mejorar el nivel de utilidades al momento de vender. 
Luz manifiesta que esta actividad le ha dado todo lo que hoy tiene y nunca le ha faltado nada ni a ella, ni a sus hijos, por lo que desea darle continuidad a esta actividad e involucrar a sus hijos en la labor y así continuar con el legado que pasa de generación en generación, así podrán tener mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luz is a 44-year old farmer. She is hardworking and friendly. She lives with her husband and 6 children, for whom she works tirelessly.

From a very young age, her parents taught her all the agricultural tasks, as it was the only livelihood option they had. Thanks to this, she now makes her living raising and selling chickens and pigs in the municipal market where she lives or to neighbors in the area.

The loan she has applied for will be invested in purchasing broiler chickens and chicken feed for feeding the animals. This will allow her to increase her production capacity and improve her earnings at the time of sales.

Luz says that this business has given her everything she has today, and neither she nor her children have wanted for anything. This is why she wants to continue with this business and involve her children in the labor, and thus continue with the legacy that gets passed down from generation to generation. This will allow them to have better health and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens and chicken feed to feed the animals.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers  in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.

Mohamed is married and has three children. Both he and his wife are farmers. Mohamed also works as a laboratory technician at a local high school. He and his wife are currently growing cashew nuts on their land and are excited to start beekeeping as it will give them another revenue stream to draw from. 

This is Mohamed’s first loan with Kiva and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to start a grocery business. In the future, Mohamed hopes to expand his apiary to twenty hives.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Soy transportista particular empece hace 13 años trabaje con mi papa y entre el y yo eramos socios me case y el camion ya no daba para los gastos de ambos vendimos el camion y nos dividimos y yo me compre una camioneta, trabaje para una empresa de alimentos como transportista particular y agremiado a una linea de transporte dure 5 años vendí la camioneta y me compre una camioneta más nueva y empece a trabajar como comodín, luego vendí mi camioneta y me compre una mas nueva del año 2000. Nunca había tenido prestamos ya que ahorro y compro todo al contado estoy en union libre tengo 2 hijos mi esposa trabaja en educación.
estoy solicitando el prestamos porqué necesito hacer un ajuste de motor  a mi camioneta. En el futuro quiero que las empresas que necesiten transportes se fijen en mi camioneta y les pueda hacer fletes.
texts.en:
Felipe is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is his story.

I am an independent carrier.  I started 13 years ago, and I worked with my father.  We were partners.  I got married, and the truck no longer paid for both of our expenses.  We sold the truck, and we divided it up.  I bought a truck, and I worked for a food company as an independent carrier and joined a transportation line union.  That lasted five years.  I sold the truck and bought a newer truck.  I started to work as a jack of all trades.  I later sold my truck and bought a newer one from the year 2000.

I have never had loans because I save and buy everything for cash.  I am in a common-law marriage and have two children.  My wife works in education.

I am requesting the loan because I need to make an adjustment to my truck.  In the future I want the companies that need transportation to notice my truck, and I will be able to transport freight for them.

loans.use: to fix his truck's motor.

loans.name: Myline Flaire

texts.fr: Myline est une femme de 31 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. elle gère un stand de vente de crédit de communication dans un quartier de la ville depuis 2 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de crédit de communication en achetant du crédit pour 150 000 francs. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans le capital et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Myline is a 31-year-old single woman with no children.  She has run a business selling telephone credit in an area of her town for two years.

She has requested this loan to increase her stock of telephone credit by buying 150,000 francs CFA worth of credit.  

She will use the earnings that she generates to reinvest capital in her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy telephone credit for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Mary is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling sandals in Besease (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. Mary is married and has two children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Mary wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of sandals. In the long term, Mary plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of sandals.

loans.name: Brenda Veronica

texts.es: Brenda de 36 años de edad se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de productos de uso personal, como lociones, desodorantes, cremas para el cabello y para el cuerpo, shampoo, acondicionadores, etc.  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como motorista y sus dos hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para surtir aun mas su negocio ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Brenda is 36 years old and has worked for five years now selling personal products, such as lotions, deodorants, creams for hair and for skin, shampoo and conditioner, etc. Her business is located in her home. She makes enough income from her sales that, along with her husband’s income, she and her husband are able to pay for their household expenses. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver, and they live together with their two children in their own home.

Brenda would like to grow her business. She is requesting this loan to buy lotions, deodorants, creams for hair and for skin, shampoo and conditioner and other items she needs to keep her business well-stocked. She has many customers who will buy her products at affordable prices. She hopes to improve her profits so that she can give her family all that they need.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, creams for hair and for skin, shampoo and conditioner, etc.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is 42 years old, divorced, and has two children. She sews dresses in her house, which she has been doing for more than 15 years. She has regular customers. 

Gulchehra lives in a rural area in an old house. She wants to repair her house but she does not have enough money because she uses her money for living expenses and the education of her children. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 Somoni, which she will use to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc.

loans.use: to purchase building materials as cement, wood, etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Hannah is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling sandals in Besease (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Hannah is married and has four children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Hannah will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of sandals, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of sandals, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Fedelia

texts.en: Fedelia is involved in selling fried yams and potatoes in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a peasant farmer) support their 8 children. She has been involved in selling fried yams, potatoes and other small items for 8 years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of yams, sweet potatoes, and gallons of oil, thus helping her to sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits to better market her fried yam enterprise and to increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of yams, sweet potatoes, and gallons of oil, thus helping her to sell more due to increased inventory capacity.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a small trader who sells crates of eggs at Abura, located in Cape Coast. She sells to individuals and also supplies to others for resale. She has no formal education but this has not stopped her from making it in life. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mechanic. She has been selling eggs for five years. Her income is used to support her husband in paying the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase increased amounts of eggs thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. Esi hopes to use the profits from her sales to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive quality education.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of eggs thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Adolph

texts.en: Adolph is married with 3 children. He received schooling up until the end of middle school. Currently, Adolph sells recharge credit cards in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). He has been involved in this industry for about 6 years now. His wife is a small trader. Adolph’s income goes towards helping his wife pay for the family's general expenses. Adolph will use the loan to buy different types of rechargeable credit cards to increase his existing cards capacity. With the new profits from his expanded enterprise, Adolph plans to develop his business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to buy different types of rechargeable credit cards to increase his existing cards capacity.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is married with 2 children.  She has received some schooling through the end of her senior year in high school. Currently, Doris sells fried fish and also operates a tomatoes, pepper and onion local grinder in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe).  She has been involved in this industry for about ten years now. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Doris’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Doris will use the loan to purchase a carton of frozen fish and a gallon of oil to increase her existing fried fish capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Doris plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets and also acquire a new grinder to have a second location in her community since there is pressure on the current mill she operates.

loans.use: to purchase a carton of frozen fish and a gallon of oil to increase her existing fried fish capacity.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Abdul, a married father of three children aged 4, 2 and 18 months, the oldest a school-going child. In 2008, Abdul established his used clothing business, a livelihood taught to him by the uncle who raised him. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 850,000 every month from this business. Competition is very high.

Abdul is requesting a loan for Le 3,000,000 to buy bales of used clothing. Committed to his business, he hopes to expand in the future, and accessing loans in ARD will be a great help. As well, he plans to educate his children and develop his family. Abdul thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 25 years old and married. He is an employee at a manufacturing plan where he earns $500 a month.

Ahmad requesting a loan from Ryada, which he will use to buy flagstones to pave his house. He and his wife currently live with a relative until their house is ready.

loans.use: to buy flagstones to pave his house

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan previously accessed a PHP 18,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her children’s education and her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Susan would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 25,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to help her relatives who are in need. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Wupa

texts.en:
With her first loan Wupa, a woman who is dedicated to reaching her dreams, was able to open her hair salon and now is working to develop it further. She has gained a good flow of customers and a strong reputation.

Wupa has requested this loan to help make renovations and purchase a hair washing station, a cutting and styling station and materials. She wants one day to develop her salon into a full service beauty center with clients throughout the region.

loans.use: to make renovations and purchase a hair washing station, a cutting and styling station and materials.

loans.name: Ruth Gardenia

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 32 años es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Canton Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Rios.

Es integrante de la ventanilla ANCHOVETA se encuentre ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto Anchoveta pertenece al Canton Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agricolas.

Ruth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, arroz y  frejol,  las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas gruesas y semillas de frejol y arroz, insecticidas, fertilizantres y abonos para la siembras. El credito le ayudado para para aumentar los ingresos para la familia. 

El sueño es tener terrenos construir unas chancheras para dedicarse a criar chanchitos para vender.

Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es la competencia y el mal clima. 

En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar y ver la television.
texts.en:
Ruth is 32 years old, single and lives with her parents in the canton of Pueblo Viejo in the province of Los Rios. She is a member of the "ANCHOVETA" communal bank which is located in Anchoveta village, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which belongs to the Canton of Pueblo Viejo. 

Ruth works in agriculture growing corn, rice and beans. She buys and sells in Ventanas. The loan she is requesting is to buy broad bean seeds, bean and rice seeds, insecticides, fertilizer and manure for her crops. The loan will help her increase the income for her family. 

Her dream is to build some pig styes to raise pigs for sale. The challenges she faces are the competition and bad weather. In her free time she enjoys relaxing and watching TV.

loans.use: to buy broad bean seeds, bean and rice seeds, insecticides, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Jonathan Miguel

texts.es:
Jonathan tiene 23 años de estado civil  unión libre tiene un hijo vive con la conyugue y el hijo en el Canton Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Rios.

Jonathan pertenece a la ventanilla ANCHOVETA se encuentre ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto Anchoveta pertenece al Canton Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agricolas.

Jonathan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y  arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pollos. Las compras y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantres, abonos, una bomba para fumigar y balanceado para la alimentar a los cerdos y morocho. El credito le ayudado a suplir las necesidades de la familia y de la produccion. 

El sueño es tener riego en los terrenosa ya que no siempre tienen agua.

Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado la falta de agua ya que no llueve. En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbool y descansar.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 23 years old and has a common law marriage. He has one son, and lives with his partner and son in the Pueblo Viejo Canton, De Los Rios Province.

Jonathan belongs to the ANCHOVETA community bank, which is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish, Anchoveta precinct. It belongs to the Pueblo Viejo Canton and is an agricultural area.

Jonathan makes his living in agriculture, planting corn and rice. He also raises pigs and chickens. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

He is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, a pump for fumigating, animal feed to feed the pigs, and corn. The loan has helped him meet the needs of his family and of production.

His dream is to have irrigation in the fields, because they don't always have water. The challenge he has faced is the lack of water since it doesn't rain. In his free time, he likes to play soccer and rest.

loans.use: seeds, fertilizers, compost, a pump for fumigating, animal feed to feed the pigs and corn.

loans.name: Mery Janeth

texts.es:
Mery tiene 42 años de edad de estado civil en union libre tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo con la conviviente en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es Integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Pechiche Reciunto Anchoveta, pertenece al Cantòn Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrìcolas, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Meru se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y para la crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos y morochos para los pollos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la agricultura.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas. 

El desafío a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y el mal clima.

El sueño es tener un terreno para construir la casa para la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y descanzar por el trabajo es muy duro.
texts.en:
Mery is 42 and has a partner and a son and lives with them in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. She is a member of the “Anchoveta” communal bank located in Pechinche Parish, Anchoveta Recinto, belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton; the members work in agriculture and animal husbandry. Mery works in agriculture growing corn and rice and raising chickens. 

Mery is asking for the loan to buy seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, manure and hard corn for the chickens. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for agriculture. Her purchases and sales take place in Ventanas and the challenges she faces are competition and bad weather. Her dream is to have a plot of land to build a house for her family. In her free time she likes doing sport and resting, because her work is very hard.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicides, fertilizers, manure and hard corn for the chickens.

loans.name: Carlos Stiven

texts.es:
El es Carlos Stiven, es un joven que quiere salir adelante, por este motivo estudia una carrera técnica, uno de los mayores anhelos es poder terminar los estudios y ser un chef reconocido y así poder viajar por muchos países para conocer mas sobre el tema de la gastronomía, el joven se decidió por esta carrera ya que desde muy temprana edad le llamo mucho la atención este arte , el se ha desempeñado muy bien sobre este tema y gracias a las pocas bases que ha aprendido le han servido laboralmente, es por esto que el joven aprovecha al máximo cada clase y cada taller para así tener mas conocimientos del tema, uno de los grandes propósitos es poder ayudar a los padres para así devolverles algo de todo lo que ellos han echo para sacarlo adelante, el es un joven con muchos valores y capacidades ya que en esta área se desenvuelve correctamente y responsable mente, para el joven el  tema de la gastronomía es muy importante ya que la mama tenia un restaurante y así lo ayudo a salir adelante desde pequeño, la mama le enseño las bases solidas como lo es manipular alimentos y el cuidado al manejar los elementos de la cocina ya que pueden ser peligrosos.
El convenio con kiva seria de gran ayuda ya que podría terminar su técnico y cumplir el sueño de poder ser un chef reconocido, ya que el pago de las mensualidades serian mas cómodas para los papas.
texts.en:
Meet Carlos Stiven. This young man wants to get ahead so he is studying a technical career. One of his greatest dreams is to finish his studies and become a well-known chef. He would like to travel in other countries to know more about gastronomy. He has chosen the career which since he was young attracted his attention. 

He has performed well in this field and thanks to the few basics he has learned serves him well in his employment. So he takes advantage of his classes to the maximum and learns more with each workshop. 

One of his goals is to help his parents and through this give something back for all they have done to get him ahead. Carlos is a youth with many values and abilities. In his field he has progressed well and in a responsible manner. 

The topic of gastronomy  is very important as his mother has a restaurant and this has helped him get ahead since he was young. He learned the basics from his Mom, for example how to use foods and the care in managing the equipment in the kitchen that can be dangerous. 

A loan from Kiva would be of great use as he could finish his training and achieve his dream of becoming a well-known chef. The monthly payments would be easier for his parents.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Luís Amadeo

texts.es:
Luís de 47 años de edad,  esta acompañado y padre de dos hijos.  él estudio hasta noveno grado.
  Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos,  que le apoyan en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de los animales que poseen (vacas).

Luís junto a sus hijos se dedican a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres.  Para llegar a la parcelas camina 1.5 Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que posee.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes que necesita, para arar la tierra donde cultiva y podrá obtener un ingreso adicional por arar otras parcelas lo que le ayudara a mantener a su familia.

 Luís planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de venta de leche, de la siembra y del préstamo para la compra de la yunta de bueyes; podrá comprar mas vacas lecheras y poder producir lácteos para la venta.
texts.en:
Luís, 47, is married and has two children. He was in school up until the ninth grade.

Luís wakes up at 5 am together with his wife and his children, who help him with his work in agriculture and with looking after their cows.

Luís and his children work in farming, an occupation he learnt from his parents. He has to walk 1.5 km to get to his land and he works hard during the morning while his wife takes care of the household chores and looks after the cows.

The loan he is asking for is to buy a pair of oxen, which he needs to plough the land where he grows his crops. He will also be able to earn extra money by ploughing other people's land, helping him to provide for his family.

With the money he gets from selling milk, from his produce and from the loan, Luís will be able to buy more cows and produce more dairy products to sell.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen, which he needs to plough the land where he grows his crops

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Even though Efua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. She is an entrepreneur who sells cassava in the village of Besease. Her business has grown substantially since she began three years ago. Efua is married and the mother of four children. Her husband works as a welder. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua wants to use her loan to buy more supplies so that she can sell greater quantities of cassava. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits in her business, so that it can expand and help meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to sell greater quantities of cassava.

loans.name: Soraida Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Soraida es una mujer responsable,  que vela por el progreso en su hogar    actualmente tiene a un hijo  bajo su cargo a quien  le brinda sus estudios para que se prepare y sea profesional, ella se mantiene gracias a su pulpería, con los ingresos se ayuda para sus diferentes gastos del hogar, doña Soraida solicita este apoyo de crédito para comprar materiales de construcción  para hacer un cuarto, sus intensiones con este cuarto es poderlo alquilar  y de esta manera obtener otros ingresos para complementar sus diferentes gastos y así ayudar más a su familia.
texts.en: Soraida is a responsible woman who ensures progress for her household. She currently has one child under her care, and she provides him with an education so he can get prepared and become a professional. She supports herself thanks to her grocery store, and the profits help her afford various household expenses. Soraida requests the help of this loan so that she can purchase construction supplies in order to build a room. She intends to be able to rent out this room and therefore obtain more earnings. That way she can cover her different expenses and thus help her family more.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand, iron and gravel.

loans.name: Melba Priscila

texts.es:
Melba tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil union libre tiene una hija, vive con la hija con el conviviente en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es Integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Pechiche Reciunto Anchoveta, pertenece al Cantòn Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrìcolas, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Melba se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos organicos y quimicos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para poder sembrar.

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas.

El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y , enfermedades en las siembras y la competencia. El sueño es tener un negocio propio de comida ya que por el sector donde viven no hay lugares para comer. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y descansar por que el trabajo es muy duro.
texts.en:
Melba is 34 years old and has a daughter and a partner. She lives with them in the the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. She’s a member of the “Anchoveta” communal bank located in Pechinche Parish, Anchoveta Recinto, belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton; the members work in agriculture and animal husbandry. Melba works in agriculture growing corn, rice and beans. 

She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, organic fertilizers and chemicals. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for sowing her crops. Her purchases and sales take place in Ventanas and the challenges she faces are pests and diseases in the crops, as well as competition. 

Her dream is to have her own food business since there are no places to eat in the area where she lives. In her free time she likes doing sport and resting because her work is very hard.

loans.use: to buy seeds, organic fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 43-year-old Lebanese single woman. She is talented at producing stamps that are sold to multiple customers. She also sells souvenir items. She has had her own shop since 2000 and it’s adjacent to her house. Today, Alice is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to purchase products needed such as inks, stamp covers and additional souvenir objects so as to augment her selling rate and as a result receive more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase products needed such as inks, stamp covers and additional souvenir objects.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en: Mike is a 36-year-old single man. He has owned a bakery since 2007 where he produces delicious and fresh pastries. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to buy supplies such as a small oven, baking tools and trays so as to ease his food preparation and increase his business productivity and thus his income. In the future, Mike plans to expand his business into other areas where he will start to serve food plates as well.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as a small oven, baking tools and trays.

loans.name: Lydia K.

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Lydia K.  She is single and has no children.   In 2008, Lydia K. established her local goods (palm oil, rice and beans) business. She began her business after she graduated from college.  She could not find a job so she decided to go into trade.  Being in this business has been a great help to meet her basic needs.  Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about Le 676,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Lydia K. requires a loan in order to purchase rubbers (plastic containers) of palm oil and palm boiled rice. In the future, Lydia K. plans to expand her business. Changes in prices of goods are her major challenge.  She is hard working and committed to her business.  She hopes to access more loans because it will help to improve her business.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rubbers of palm oil and palm boiled rice.

loans.name: Ibrahim M.

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Ibrahim M.  He is single and has 1 child, aged 3 years. In 2005, Ibrahim M. established his soap, soft drinks, biscuit, toothpaste, Pure Water, milk, etc. business. He began his business because he used to assist his brother in business, but when his brother traveled abroad, he took over the business.  The business has now grown from a stall to a shop.  Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Ibrahim M. requires a loan in order to buy cartons of batteries, crates of soft drinks and cartons of soap and milk. In the future, Ibrahim M. plans to buy a piece a land, educate his child and expand the business. The loan will help him to achieve some of his future plans; inadequate capital is his main problem.  He is a hardworking business man, he thanks ARD for the support in financing his business.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of batteries, crates of soft drinks and cartons of soap and milk.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El Señor  Hugo tiene 45 años, soltero, él se dedica a la pesca desde hace ya bastante tiempo, el vive en la isla de Ticata,  El Señor  Hugo aprendió esta actividad de su padre que también se dedicaba a la pesca,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Señor  Hugo va a usar este préstamo para compra  de un motor para su bote, la pesca lo realiza cerca del  lago Titicaca en la comunidad la mayoría de los pobladores se dedica a la pesca y a la elaboración de artesanías ya que tiene la visita de muchos turistas, el Señor  Hugo enfrenta retos ya que según al clima ya que está en época de lluvia la pesca no el buena, el es una persona con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 45 years old and single. He has worked as a fisherman for some time now. He lives on the island of Ticata. Hugo learned how to fish from his father, who was also a fisherman.

This is Hugo’s first loan cycle with the field partner. He will use the loan to buy an outboard motor for his boat. Hugo fishes in his community, near Lake Titicaca. The majority of the inhabitants there work fishing and making artisanal products, because many tourists visit this area.

One challenge Hugo faces is the climate. During the rainy season, the fishing is not good. Hugo wants to continue working to get ahead. He is happy for this opportunity that has been given him to improve his business and therefore his income.

loans.use: to buy an outboard motor for his boat.

loans.name: David Adrian

texts.es: El señor David es una persona responsable y trabajadora, tiene un nivel de educación bachiller. Empezó a trabajar como ayudante en construcciones desde muy joven y poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia hasta que se volvió contratista independiente, ahora cuenta con una maquinaria propia pero necesita otra más por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de una máquina (mezcladora de tres cubos) para realizar su trabajo de forma más eficiente y cubrir  la demanda de obras que tiene.
texts.en: Sr. David is a responsible, hardworking person who has a university degree. He started work as a helper on a construction site when he was a young man and gradually gained experience to the point where he became an independent contractor. Now he has his own equipment but he needs another machine. For this reason David is seeking a loan to buy a 3 cubic foot concrete mixer so he can work more efficiently and complete his current work orders.

loans.use: buy a 3-cubic foot concrete mixer

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio tiene 69 años de edad de estado civil unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la compañera en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta, pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Anastacio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol ademas a la crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes, una bomba para fumigar y morocho para los pollos. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura las compras las realizará en ventanas. 

El sueño es tener un rigo propio que aun no ha podido comprar. En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y ver la television en especial ver las noticias.
texts.en:
Anastacio is 69 years old and has a partner but no children. He lives with his partner in Ventanas  in the Los Ríos province. He is a member of the ANCHOVETA communal bank, located in the Puerto Pechiche parish, Anchoveta Recinto, belonging to the Pueblo Viejo canton. The members work in agriculture. Anastacio earns a living from agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans as well as rearing chickens. 

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, a pump for fumigating and hard corn for the chickens. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for agriculture, making his purchases in Ventanas.

His dream is to have his own irrigation system which he has not yet been able to buy. In his free time he likes resting and watching television, especially the news.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, a pump for fumigating and hard corn for the chickens.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.fr: La cliente Isabel est un officier des opérations de terrain dans une organisation de société civile. Elle est parent de 3 élèves inscrits régulièrement à l’école primaire. Elle a été informée de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais de scolarité. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants et souhaite les voir  devenir des ingénieurs informaticiens, médecin,  cadre d’entreprise, professeur d’université,  Révérend pasteur, parlementaires,  etc. Au finish, elle salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de  la reconstruction de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Isabel works as a field operator for a civil organisation.  She has three children who all attend primary school.  She has recently learned of a new initiative offered by the field partner, Hekima.  This offers the opportunity to pay school fees in advance.  So, she will use her loan to pay for the school fees of her children for the complete year 2013-2014.  This will ensure that they do not miss any schooling during the year.

Isabel dreams of a better future for her children and would like them to become computer technicians, doctors, business managers, university professors, reverends or politicians.

Isabel is very grateful for this special initiative, offered by Hekima, which will have a big social impact.  She believes it is particularly important during the time of reconstruction in the east of the country

loans.use: to pay school fees.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fidelicia

texts.es:
Fidelicia, es una persona que estudio hasta educación media. Su esposo, la abandono y la dejo con sus  2 hijos.  Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para llevar preparar la mercadería que llevara para la venta. 

Ella  se dedica a vender ropa desde hace varios años, oficio que le  enseño su madre, durante el día visita los alrededores de donde reside y los municipios cercanos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más ropa,  ya que actualmente no cubre la demanda que posee lo que le genera que sus ingresos se vean afectados.

Fidelicia planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de su actividad comercial y del préstamo para la compra de mercadería, en un futuro desea establecer su negocio formal.
texts.en:
Fidelicia studied up to high school. Her husband left her with their two children. She gets up at 4:30 a.m. to prepare the merchandise that she will sell.

She has been selling clothing for several years, an occupation that her mother taught her. Throughout the day, she goes around the outskirts of where she lives and to nearby towns.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy more clothing, considering that she currently is unable to meet customer demand which is affecting her income. 

Fidelicia plans to use her earnings as well as this loan to buy merchandise. In the future, she hopes to formalize her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel de 63 años de edad,  es agricultor, casado y estudio hasta sexto grado. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos  que le apoyan en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de los animales que poseen.


 Miguel junto a sus hijos se dedican a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres. Para llegar a la parcelas camina 5 Km y trabaja durante todo el día y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que posee.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca lechera que le venden,  para producir mas leche ya que actualmente la que producen es solo para el consumo y con el incremento de la leche podrá obtener un ingreso adicional para el sustento de su familia.

Miguel planea que con los ingresos que obtenga de la venta de leche, de la siembra y del préstamo para la compra de la vaca; podrá comprar mas vacas lecheras y poder producir lácteos para la venta.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 63, is a farmer. He is married and was in school until grade 6. He wakes up every morning at 5 am. His wife and children help him with the farm work and care of their animals.

Miguel and his children work in agriculture, which he learned from his parents. In order to get to his plot of land, he walks 5 km. He works all day long. His wife does the housework and cares for their cows.

This loan is for the purchase of a dairy cow in order to produce more milk. They currently only produce milk for their own consumption. With this increase in milk production, he will be able to have an additional income for his family.

Miguel will use his income and this loan for the purchase of a cow. He will be able to buy more dairy cows and produce milk for sale.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and produce more milk.

loans.name: Haqat Group

texts.en:
This group is called Haqat and consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. Miada is 31 years old and lives with her family. For many years, she has sold ladies clothes, incense, and other goods. Miada is experienced in sales which allows her to earn a better income. She works hard to offer a good life for her family. Miada has a regular customer base that prefers her quality, affordable prices, and good service. She is a resourceful and honest woman who is dedicated to her work. 

Haqat Group is requesting a 240,000 YER loan from AMB. Miada will use her 70,000 YER portion of their loan to buy clothes, incense, and perfume for her business. She thanks Kiva lenders for financing her previous first loan.

loans.use: to buy ladies and children's clothing

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Even though Abena grew up in poverty, without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her family and herself. 

Currently, Abena is an entrepreneur. She sells foodstuffs in Besease (near Elmina). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. Abena is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of foodstuffs. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Kadie. She is divorced and the mother of two children who are 22 and 19 years old. One is still in school. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because he is attending school and helps with domestic work. In 2008, Kadie divorced her husband and opened a bar where she sells both soft drinks and liquor. She opened this business because she learned how to do this line of work when married. Her new venture  was a challenge, but things improved over the years as did her family's status.  Working seven days a week and 17 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,262,000 every month from her work. She is requesting a loan for Le 4,000,000 to buy more crates of soft drinks and liquor. In the future, Kadie plans to expand her business, and this loan will help her do that. She works hard, but this type of work requires a fair amount of capital. Securing a loan will allow her to meet customer demand. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy crates of soft drinks and liquor.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Marie.  She is married to a trader who earns Le 500,000 every month  and has one child aged 11 years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because her husband brought them from their village to help with their schooling.  

In 2001, Marie established a business selling household utensils.  She began her business because she was not privileged to go school, and as an adult her older brother gave her some money to start selling cakes. After she got married, her husband asked her to begin selling household utensils because of the fire risk involved in baking cakes.  Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like to borrow Le 5,000,000, and has already received and successfully repaid two loans. She will use this new loan to buy more water containers, bathing buckets, pans, dishes and plastic bowls to sell. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.

Marie used the proceeds from her last loan to pay school fees for her child, help her husband feed their family and buy some items for her home. However she was not able to invest in building a house because she was not able to save enough money to do this. In the future, Marie still plans to build her own house and educate her children to the university level. She feels good because this loan will add to her capital and help her improve her business and earn more income. She is hardworking and honest, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy and transport new items to sell.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, rice, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good location and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add a stock of sugar, bread, rice and other items. 

She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add a stock of sugar, bread, rice and other items.

loans.name: Marilec

texts.es: Marilec, tiene 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos dos están estudiando, su esposo labora como albañil, juntos reúnen sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a sus hijos para  darles una buena educación, doña Marilec  habita junto a su familia en un barrio  muy visitado por los delincuentes, por este motivo desea asegurar su vivienda poniendo un muro perimetral que garantice la seguridad y el bienestar de la familia, por esta importante razón ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar los materiales como cemento, arena, hierro,  bloques y piedrines, y poder empezar la primera etapa de esta obra.
texts.en: Marilec is 39 years old and is the mother of 4 children, two of which are students. Her husband works as a mason, and together they pool their efforts to raise their children to give them a good education. Marilec lives with her family in a neighborhood that is frequented by criminals, and for this reason she wishes to secure her home by putting up a perimeter wall to ensure the safety and well-being of her family. For this important reason she is requesting a loan to be able to buy materials such as cement, sand, iron blocks, and stones, and to be able to begin the first stage of this task.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, iron blocks, and stones.

loans.name: Mkono Mukononi Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Ndalemwa est une commerçante, présidente et membre d’une association d’affaires «Mkono Mkononi», âgée de 45 ans et mère des 12 enfants dont, 6 étudient et 6 autres sont encore gamins. Elle est vendeuse  de divers articles depuis 3 ans. Elle installe ses marchandises à son domicile sur la rue dans une avenue animée de la place. Elle  sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise.Son conjoint est un technicien de construction (Maçon). Elle va acheter 1 sac de farine formant, 1 carton de jus locale, les allumettes, 1 carton de savons, 1 sac de sucre, des bonbons, biscuits, sel iodé, 30 litres huiles etc. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir  et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique. Dans photo du groupe, une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Ndalemwa is a trader and the president of the business group 'Mkono Mukononi'.  She is 45 years old and has twelve children.  Six of her children attend school and the other six are too young.  Her husband is a building technician (a mason).

Ndalemwa has sold various products for three years, from her home on a busy local avenue.  She started her business with funds that she received from her husband.

In order to improve her business, Ndalemwa has requested a loan from the field partner, Hekima.  She will use her loan to buy a sack of wheat flour, a box of local juice, matches, a box of soaps, a sack of sugar, sweets, biscuits, iodized salt and thirty litres of oil. 

In the future, Ndalemwa would like to increase her working capital and educate, clothe and feed her children.

She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to women entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

One of the clients is holding her child in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of wheat flour, 1 box of local juice, matches, 1 box of soaps, 1 sack of sugar, sweets, biscuits, iodized salt and 30 litres of oil.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en: Edilberto is married and a father of three adult children. He has been farming rice for 10 years. He is from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. As of now, Edilberto is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay the labor costs of the farm. Edilberto hopes of expanding his farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the labor costs of the farm.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Pilar

texts.es: Doña Yamileth es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco casada y madre de dos hijos. Tiene 29 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa usada. Inicio su negocio hace varios años con dinero propio y fue así como logro salir adelante. Su meta próxima es comprar pacas de ropa variada para incrementar la venta de su negocio. Solicita el crédito para compra pacas de ropa variada tanto para niños como para adultos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para surtir su negocio, obtener mejores ganancias y poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Su plan futuro es cancelar el crédito recibido y obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Yamileth is from the city of Boaco. She is 29 years old, she is married, and she has two children. She buys and sells used clothing, a business that she started several years ago with her own money; and this is how she has been able to get by. 

Her next goal is to purchase bundles of mixed clothing in order to increase sales for her business.

She is seeking a loan for the purchase of mixed bundles of clothing for children as well as for adults, and she believes that the loan will be of great help to her in supplying her business so that she can achieve better earnings and be able to improve the structure of her house.

Her plan for the future is to pay back the loan she has received and obtain a new one.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of mixed clothing for children as well as for adults.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
