Luis, a sus 61 años de edad, sigue trabajando arduas jornadas para generar ingresos para el sustento propio y el de su único hijo al que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo.
Lleva más de 25 años dedicándose al comercio independiente, vende diversos artículos como grameras, básculas, equipos de soldadura y herramientas diversas; el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos.
El cliente se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre amable, dinámico y servicial, cualidades que le permiten abrir su mercado y sus clientes. Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio con más variedad de inventario, solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (grameras, básculas, entre otros), así podrá satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y mejorará el nivel de ingresos.
Luis manifiesta que su edad no le impide soñar, por ello quiere seguir trabajando para lograr tener una microempresa mucho más organizada, en un local comercial con un ambiente agradable y en la que pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos, así podrá tener mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luis, at 61 years old, is still working arduously to generate income to support himself and his only son that he has brought up with great effort. He has worked in the independent trade for more than 25 years; he sells various items such as scales, welding equipment, and various tools. He learned the trade empirically and it has become his sole source of income. 

The client has been characterized as a friendly, dynamic, and helpful man, all qualities which allow him to set up his market and his clients. In an effort to strengthen his business with a larger variety of inventory, he is requesting the loan in order to buy assorted wholesale goods (scales, etc.), so that he may meet the needs of his customers and improve his level of income.

Luis says that his age does not prevent him from dreaming, so he would like to continue working towards having a much more organized micro-enterprise, in a shop with a friendly atmosphere where he can offer a greater variety of items, so that he may have better living conditions and welfare.

loans.use: buy assorted wholesale goods (scales, etc.)

loans.name: Nyangota B Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of farmers called Nyangota. They are based in the Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Elizabeth has her hand raised. She is a 56-year-old married woman with four children. Her children all attend school. 

Susan has been a member of the group for three years, and she is the group’s chairperson. Susan has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on her farm to grow maize, sorghum, and millet during the 2014 rainy seasons. She is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that would enable her purchase the necessities for her farming operations. She believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizers would increase her yield, which would provide not just enough food for her large family but also surplus to sell for profits. Any profits generated as a result of the loan would be used pay for her children’s school fees and other living expenses.

loans.use: To expand farming operations by purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizers to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Nyasagati Group

texts.en:
Nyasagati is a Nuru International group of four farmers based in the Kuria West district of Kenya. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.The person raising his hand in the picture is Francis. He is 52 years old and married with four children. Francis has been a member of the group for two years, and he is the group’s chairperson. 

Francis has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum, and millet during the 2014 long-rains season.  However, he faces financial constraints. He is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him purchase the farm inputs. He believes that the use of farm inputs will increase his yields, and he will not only be able to provide enough food for his family, but he will also have a surplus to sell in order to purchase a dairy cow that will produce milk to sell.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: St Peters Group

texts.en:
St. Peters Group is a Nuru International group of 13 farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru International to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.

Susan, who is raising up her hand, is the chairperson of the group and has been a member of the group since the year 2010. She is 38 years old and is married with four children. The loan from Kiva will enable her to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer, which will enable her obtain high crop yields. Susan, just like other members of her group, will use the loan for one acre. She will grow maize on a one-half acre, and sorghum and millet on a quarter acre each. She plans to sell the surplus and pay school fees for her children. She also plans to join a savings-and-loan plan, so she will save some of the money obtained from selling the surplus.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Kilimo A Group

texts.en:
Kilimo A is a Nuru International group of three farmers in Kuria West district. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru International to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of Kilimo A collectively guarantee the loan.

Michael is the leader of the group. He is 56 years old and has been farming for about 10 years. He has benefited from the group since the year 2010. Michael is married with eight children. The loan from Kiva will enable him acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer which should increase his production of maize, sorghum, and millet. Michael hopes to obtain enough food for his family and sell the surplus; he wants to invest the money from the sales in a business which will later generate profits used to pay school fees for his eight children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Nyamotambe Group

texts.en:
Nyamotambe is a Nuru International group of two farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.
Daniel pictured with his hand raised is a representative of the group. Daniel is 32 years old, married, and has six children. He has been a member of this group for three years now.

The loan from Kiva in this coming season will enable Daniel to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer, which he believes will increase his farm yields. Daniel, just like the other member of his group, will take input loans for one acre. He will grow maize on a 1/2 acre and sorghum and millet on a ¼ acre each. He will obtain food for his household and sell the surplus in order to invest in another business, as well as build a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Wisdom Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of four farmers called Wisdom, and it is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up his hand in the picture is John. He is 20 years old and married with two children who attend school. John has been a member of the group for two years and he is the group’s chairperson.

John has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons. He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase the farm inputs. He believes that the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields, and he will not only get enough food for his family, but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Transformer Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of four farmers called Transformer, and it is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising up his hand is James. He is 34 years old and married with three children who go to school. James has been a member of the group for three years, and he is the group’s chairperson.

James has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons. He is, however, constrained financially, and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase the hybrid seeds and fertilizer. He believes that the use of these farm inputs will increase his yields, and he will not only get enough food for his large family, but will also sell the surplus and invest in a business to obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees and other domestic uses.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Getachonga Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of six farmers called Getachonga. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Sylevester, who is raising his hand, is 45 years old and married with five children who all go to school. He has been a member of the group for two years now.

With his loan, Sylevester envisions acquiring hybrid seeds and fertilizer for growing ½ an acre of maize and ¼ each of sorghum and millet. He hopes this will result in him having a good harvest that will ensure food security for his household. He will also sell the surplus and spend the money paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Kuirengo Group

texts.en:
Kwirengo is a Nuru International group of four farmers in Kuria West District. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group the members collectively guarantee the loan.

Robert is the leader of the group. He is 56 years old and has been farming for about 10 years. He has benefited from the group since the year 2010. He is married, with eight children. 

The loan from Kiva will enable him acquire farm hybrid seeds and fertilizer, which should increase his production of maize, sorghum, and millet. 

Robert hopes to obtain enough food for his family and sell the surplus, investing the money from the sales in a business that will later generate profits. Those will be used to pay school fees for his eight children.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Getachongo Center Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of seven farmers called Getachongo Center; it is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture. The person raising up his hand is Stephen. He is 42 years old, married with four children who attend school. Stephen has been a member of the group for three years and he is the group’s chairperson.

Stephen has been learning better farming methods within his group and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons. He is however constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him to purchase the hybrid seeds and fertilizer. He believes that the use of farm inputs will increase his yields, and he will not only get enough food for his family, but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Nyabori Group

texts.en:
Nyabori is a Nuru International group of four farmers in Kuria West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge on improved farming methods. They are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.

Pauline, who is raising her hand in the photo, is the chairperson of the group. She has been a member of the group since the year 2010. She is 32 years old and is married, with two children who go to school. 

The loan from Kiva will enable her to acquire hybrid seeds and fertilizer, which will enable her to obtain high yields. Pauline, just like the other members of her group, will take input loans for one acre. She will grow maize on ½ acre, and sorghum and millet on ¼ acre each. 

She plans to sell the surplus and pay school fees for her children. She also plans to join a savings and loaning scheme, so she will save some of the money obtained from selling the surplus. This will give her more financial independence.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua did not have any form of formal education, but this has not stopped her from achieving a better life. 

She sells smoked fish at Abura, Cape Coast. She buys already-smoked fish from wholesalers to resell to individuals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Efua is married, with four children.  The income from her business is used in helping her husband (who is a steel bender) to pay her children’s school fees. 

She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her fish. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish to sell, to increase her inventory levels. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to be educated.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell, to increase her inventory levels.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa produces and sells soap in Abura, Cape Coast. She has been in this business for five years. She had no formal education yet this has not stopped her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. 

She has noticed that there is a growing demand among customers for her soap but she cannot meet those needs due to lack of funding. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase raw materials and other ingredients for her soap production in order to increase sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa wants to ensure that all her children will be given the right to a quality education and will achieve a better life in future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and other ingredients for her soap production business.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: El grupo “Dios Es Amor” está conformada por 08 mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras que han ido mejorando con el transcurso del tiempo. Ella es Alejandra una socia de 48 años, separada con 04 hijos, 01 de ellos en etapa escolar. Alejandra se dedica a la venta de artefactos y lleva más de 05 años en dicho negocio, la cual lo realiza en un mercado de su localidad. Gracias a su negocio y perseverancia a logrado mejorar su vivienda. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de parlantes, USB, radios y de esta manera poder ofrecer a sus clientes. El deseo de Alejandra es de poner otro puesto, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El grupo “Dios Es Amor” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Alejandra se encuentra sentada y viste  polo y casaca negra.
texts.en:
“Dios Es Amor” communal bank comprises eight, hardworking, striving women who have improved their circumstances. Alejandra, 48, belongs to the group, is separated, and has four children, one of whom is in school.  Alejandra has been selling electronic devices in a local market for more than five years. Thanks to her business and perseverance, she has been able to remodel her house. 

She will use this loan to buy speakers, USBs, and radios to sell to customers. Alejandra wants to open another stall so that she can earn more. “Dios Es Amor” communal bank thanks Kiva lenders for their support. Alejandra is seated above and is wearing a black t shirt and sweater.

loans.use: to buy speakers, USBs, and radios.

loans.name: Mahsudjon

texts.en:
Mahsudjon is an ambitious man. He is going to establish a new business by opening a café, because he needs money to provide for his three children and his wife. His wife is a hair maker. His children are young, not yet adults. 

Mahsudjon is going to open the café and cook national dishes for the local people. He will cook dishes for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. He is going to open the café in the center of his region. 

He is asking for a loan of 3000 USD to buy food items and also to repair the place. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items and also to repair the place for establishing a new business.

loans.name: George

texts.en: This is 34-year-old George. He is married and has two children, ages 14 and 10. He has two additional dependents. In 2006, George established his commercial beer, stout and soft drinks business. He began his business because he could not further his education and decided to find himself in the field of business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. George requires a loan in order to buy more drinks of his customers' choice like beer and stout. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his profit margin. In the future, George plans to open a branch in one of the provinces after doing thorough market research. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks of his customers' choice like beer and stout.

loans.name: Stanslaus

texts.en:
Stanslaus is a 48-year-old married man. He has 8 children. He describes himself as committed. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an area fit for business and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be government policies which affect his business. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more tools for repairing motor vehicles. 

His business goal is to be stable within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be stable. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more tools for repairing motor vehicles.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from two years to 6 years. He describes himself as industrious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are local residents.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another bicycle. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy another bicycle.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta is a 35-year-old married woman with five children aged 17, 14, 12, 8, and 6 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her because she assists them with their schooling.  

In 2009, Fanta established her business. She began her business because, after her father's death when she was a child, there was no one to support her. Her mother gave her in marriage to a contractor, who gave her money to start a business.  Fanta previously experienced difficulty and therefore added local food products to her business. Her profit margin has improve.   She works seven days a week, 14 hours a day and earns about 1,600,000 SLL every month from her new business. 

Fanta would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Fanta has received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan to buy sweets, biscuits, pure water and local food items to sell.
  
Fanta has started her house project by making mud bricks.  She used most of her profits to provide a livelihood for her family.

loans.use: to buy small of sweets, biscuit, pure water and local food stuff for sale of her business.

loans.name: Saroun's Group

texts.en:
Saroun is 56 years old and a resident from Ek Phnom district in Battambang province. She is a mother of three children. To support the family’s living, she has a job as a tailor, and her husband has been a construction worker for ten years.

She and her group members are applying with VisionFund for the sixth cycle. They completely paid back their past loans which have helped her family to live in a good situation and have enough household supplies to use. Now, they are seeking loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will use her portion to buy construction materials for her husband's business. She hopes that her family will gain more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Yeny Yesenia

texts.es:
yeny yesenia, es  una  muchacha que actualmente estudia auxiliar de enfermería en campo alto, en el año 2014 inicia segundo semestre .
Tiene  una hija de diez años de edad y es madre soltera, trabaja en un deposito de madera, vive en el municipio de soacha.  
Ella  tiene  muchas  ganas  de  salir  a delante  con el estudio y  poder  brindar un ejemplo de vida  a la hija,  para que en un futuro ella pueda aprender  a valorar la vida  y el estudio  que con tanto esfuerzo le da a  ella.
Ella  quiere aprender  bien en el campo alto para ser  una  buena enfermera . y poder cambiar de trabajo, tener  muchas  oportunidades y poder lograr las metas  que ella se propone en la vida, pero para cumplir su primer meta es necesario terminar su técnico, por eso necesita este convenio con kiva, para poder brindarle un mejor ejemplo a su hija y que se sienta orgullosa de la labor que hace la mama.
texts.en:
Yeny Yesenia is currently studying to be a nursing assistant at CampoAlto. In 2014 she will be starting her second semester. She has a 10-year-old daughter and is a single mother. She works in a lumber yard and lives in the town of Soacha. She dreams of using her studies to get ahead in life, and to be able to give her daughter a good example to follow so that she learns to value life and study as hard as she can.

Yeny Yesenia would like to learn a lot at CampoAlto so she can be a good nurse and leave her job at the lumber yard. She hopes this will give her many opportunities and allow her to achieve the goals she has set for herself in life. However, to achieve her first goal she has to finish her training, and this is why she needs a loan from Kiva. She wants to be a good role model for her daughter and for her daughter to feel proud of what her mother does.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of her course.

loans.name: Carlota Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carlota de 53 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado de estudio, debido a que su papá murió y solo se crió con la mamá, está casada su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos, 2 ya se casaron, y solamente viven 2 y un nieto con ella. 

Carlota se dedica al trabajo en  la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años y fue con su papá que aprendió el trabajo, él siempre le decía que aprendiera a trabajar por si le iba mal con su pareja podría mantener a sus hijos; luego al casarse con su esposo siempre se ha dedicado al mismo trabajo pues es el medio con el cual han podido sacar a sus hijos adelante, pues todos han logrado sacar bachillerato. Ella se levanta a las 4:30 AM para preparar el desayuno y preparar  a los que se van a la escuela y luego se conduce a donde su esposo trabaja, donde labora 6 horas y luego regresa a casa.

El préstamo será utilizado, en la compra de insumos para la siembra de 7,500 metros cuadrados de maíz de regadío, donde comprará una bolsa de semilla, 6 sacos de abono, 2 litros de veneno y lo demás para pago de mano de obra.

Su sueño primero es pagar la deuda, para tener las puertas abiertas, sueña con ver graduarse en la universidad a su  hijo de 11 años y a su nieto de 12 años, además sueña con comprar un terreno y construir una casa.
texts.en:
Carlota is 53 and never went to school, as her father died when she was young and her mother brought her up alone. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has four children, two of whom are married and two of whom still live with her, along with her nephew.

Carlota has worked in farming since she was 12 and was taught by her father. He always used to tell her that she should learn to work so that if anything bad happened to her husband she would be able to look after the children. Later, she married a man who had always done the same work as her, so together were able to provide for their children, who have all completed their baccalaureate.

Carlota wakes up at 4:30 am to prepare breakfast and get the children ready for school. Then she drives to where her husband works, where she works for 6 hours before returning home.

The loan will be used to buy supplies for planting 7.5 km2 of maize on irrigated land. She will buy a bag of seed, 6 sacks of fertiliser, 2 litres of pesticide and the rest will be spent on manual labour. 

Her goal is to pay back the loan and to have opportunities. She dreams of seeing her 11-year-old son and 12-year-old nephew graduate university, and she would love to buy some land and build a house.

loans.use: para comprar una bolsa de semilla, 6 sacos de abono, 2 litros de veneno y lo demás para pago de mano de obra y cultivar 7,500 metros cuadrados de maíz de regadío.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Meet Caren, a resident of Nyamira. She is in farming, which she has done for 10 years. This is her family's main source of income.

She is married and has three children, all of school-going age.

She produces and sells milk, eggs, and bananas in the local market. She very much enjoys working on her dairy cows, but what affects her most is the livestock diseases and also lack of money.

Caren chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer low interest on their loans, and their services are very good. 

She said that this loan will benefit her family, bringing in more income because of the addition of a zero grazing cow structure which protects the animal and allows it to produce more milk. This will alleviate poverty due to the additional milk production.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing cow shed

loans.name: Wilson De Jesús

texts.es:
Wilson, a sus 33 años de edad, es padre de un hijo de 16 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Durante su vida productiva, se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo de alimentos, especialmente en panadería y pastelería; inició hace 15 años, cuando trabajaba con su madre en una panadería que ella tenía, allí obtuvo la experiencia y el conocimiento necesario para el manejo de este tipo de negocios, gracias a ello, hace dos años tomó la iniciativa de independizarse y abrir su propia panadería, en la que genera un empleo directo y trabaja diariamente desde las primeras horas de la mañana; así genera los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su familia.
Actualmente solicita el préstamo para comprar materia prima al por mayor (harina, arequipe de relleno, bocadillo de guayaba, margarina, aceite, esencias de diferentes sabores, entre otros) y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos; esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de materia prima para satisfacer la demanda y aumentar sus ventas, además le dará una mejor imagen al establecimiento con la vitrina, lo que podrá atraer nuevos y potenciales clientes.
Wilson se proyecta para un futuro cercano, ampliando su negocio y fortaleciéndolo con nuevos productos que deleiten el paladar de sus compradores, y generando una mayor rentabilidad para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Wilson is 33 years old and is in a common-law relationship with a 16-year-old son. Throughout his working life he has worked in the food industry, especially baking bread and cakes and other baked goods. He started 15 years ago, when he was working with his mother in her bakery. There he gained the experience and knowledge necessary in this kind of business. Two years ago, he broke out on his own and started his own bakery, in which he works every day from the very early hours of the morning, and from which he earns enough income to support his family.

Wilson is requesting this loan to buy ingredients at wholesale prices, such as flour, dulce de leche [caramelized sweetened milk] filling, guava jelly, margarine, oil, essences of different flavors, among others, and to buy a glass display case to display his products. A greater supply of ingredients would allow him to meet his customer demand and increase his sales. The glass display case would also make his shop more attractive, which would attract new and potential customers.

Wilson is planning for the near future by increasing the size of his business and strengthening it by adding new products that delight the palates of his customers. He hopes to increase his profit so that he can improve his family’s living conditions and provide them with a stable economic situation.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale prices, such as flour, dulce de leche [caramelized sweetened milk] filling, guava jelly, margarine, oil and essences of different flavors, and to buy a glass display case to display his products.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: María, tiene 46 años de edad, esta  casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de san Pedro Sula en una colonia suburbana. En busca de generar  ingresos  hace 4 años se a dedicado a la venta de cosméticos, productos de belleza y  productos de aseo personal como champú, jabón etc., las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos.  El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de nuevos productos como desodorantes, cremas, champú, tintes, maquillajes, lociones, y otros para la venta, con el propósito de aumentar las ventas. Tiene como meta  seguir con el negocio y seguir ayudando con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: María, 46, is married, has four children, and lives in a suburb of San Pedro Sula. Four years ago, she started selling cosmetics, beauty products, and personal care items like shampoo and soap to generate income. She sells her merchandise as a street vendor and to order. She has applied for a loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy new merchandise like deodorants, creams, shampoo, dyes, makeup, lotions, and more so that she can increase sales. Her goal is to keep her business running to help pay her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy new products like deodorants, creams, shampoo, dyes, makeup, lotions, and more.

loans.name: Ta-Bumsu Women Association Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu is 35 years old and was born in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and the couple has 4 children; 2  attend primary school and 2 attend secondary school. 

Isatu sells food at the market.  The products include rice, pepper, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), and palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), etc. This is the first loan that Isatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy bulk rice, pepper, onions, margi, palm-oil, etc.to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Gibrill, posing with the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy bulk rice, pepper, onions, margi, palm-oil, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: True Go Lass Group

texts.en:
Mamusu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mamusu was born in northern Sierra Leone 55 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has 5 children who attend primary and secondary schools.  Mamusu sells food at the market, including rice, pepper, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), and palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), etc. She has had this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Mamusu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mamusu will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy bulk quantities of rice, pepper, onions, margi, palm-oil, etc.  to increase her current stock.

(Also included in the right hand side of the photo is loan officer Gibrill, posing with the borrowers)

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of rice, pepper, onions, margi, palm-oil, etc.  to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Susan Andrea

texts.es:
Susan es una de nuestras socias por más de 12 meses, el último préstamo otorgado, le sirvió para realizar todos los trámites para obtener su titulo profesional.
Ella esta muy contenta por los logros académicos obtenidos, ya que muy pronto verá su meta cumplida, que es el de tener su jardín de niños.
Susan esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para hacer estudios de post - grado.
Ella esta feliz y quiere agradecer por el apoyo incondicional de los socios de Kiva, y por creer en los sueños de los jóvenes.
texts.en: Susan has been our client for more than 12 months. She used the last loan to pay her degree fees. She is pleased with her academic achievements, as she soon will meet her goal to have a kindergarten. Susan has applied for a new loan to pay for postgraduate classes. She is happy and wants to thank the Kiva lenders for their unconditional support and for believing in young people's dreams.

loans.use: to pay graduation and diploma costs.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a 55-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 17 to 35 years old. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail shop where she sells household goods. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be lack of access to clean water. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a happy family and live a healthy life. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Hog-raising is the primary source of income of Erlinda. She is from the village of Salvacion, Alicia. Erlinda is now 60 years old, married with three children; one boy and two girls. She is thankful because through her hard work and initiative she has been able to increase her income. 

Erlinda aims to have continuous smooth flow of her hog raising business. In this connection, she is seeking for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000. This amount of loan will be used to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. In this way, she can make her hogs healthier upon reaching their maturity period. She hopes to obtain the said amount of loan in order to sustain her family needs and improve her way of living.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a 22 year old married man with 1 child. He describes himself as focused. He is a mason and constructs houses. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good location and his primary customers have small projects. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy tools for his construction business. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He also works as a dairy farmer to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy tools for his construction business.

loans.name: Ya Umu

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Ya Umu. She is married and has five children ages 25, 23, 20, 17 and 14. All of them attend school.

In 1991, Ya Umu established her jeans, shirts, shoes, sandals, polo, Lacoste, school bags, traveling bags, etc. business. She began her business because her father didn't value girls' education. Ya Umu was sent to school by her step-mother, but at class II, her father stopped her from going to school.  Her step-mother introduced her to business.  When Ya Umu became an adult, her parents gave her in marriage to a businessman who established a business for her.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 3,450,000 every month from her business. 

Ya Umu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase bales of jeans, polos, blouses, and shoes.

Ya Umu was not able to open another outlet but she built the planned house after the previous loan. She is hardworking and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of jeans, polos, blouses, and shoes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Mary from Waterloo2, western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. She began her business because she wanted to improve her status of living. In 2004, Mary established her general stock business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more items, such as cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Mary plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph's group includes five group leader farmers in Matete District.  Joseph has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 56 other individual farmers represented by this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Joseph is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with six children.  Joseph is 43 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Joseph is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, savings group and prayer group.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund due to the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							
						
Joseph first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Joseph joined One Acre Fund in order to learn new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member and wants to help more farmers.  Joseph plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Joseph’s own life was improved because he was able to save money and feed the family.

Joseph's group needs a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gokebobora Group

texts.en:
These four farmers pictured are part of a Nuru International group of farmers called Gokebobora; they are based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising his hand is Ayubu. He is 25 years old, married with two children; only one of them goes to school. This is his second year as a member of this group. 

Ayubu has been learning better farming methods within his group, and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers on his farm to grow maize, sorghum, and millet during the 2014 long rains seasons.  

He is, however, constrained financially, and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva that will enable him purchase these farm inputs. 

Ayubu believes the use of hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields, and he will not only get enough food for his family, but will also sell the surplus and invest in a business to obtain money to start a shop business.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Veronique

texts.fr: véronique est une femme de 46 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants, tous allant à l'école. elle possède une boutique où elle vend du poisson et des vivres frais dans un quartier de la ville depuis 4 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant du poisson pour 40 kg et des vivres frais pour 30000 francs pour satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses bénéfices. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis sa son activité pour ouvrir une grande poissonnerie d'une part et subviendront au x besoins de la famille d'autre part.
texts.en:
Véronique, age 46, is a widow with 2 children who both go to school. She owns a shop in a local district, where she has been selling fresh fish and other foods for the past 4 years. 

She is seeking a loan to bolster her stock. She plans to buy 40 kg of fish, and 30,000 francs worth of fresh foods. This will help her to meet customer demand, and to boost her revenue. 

The profits earned will be reinvested in her activity to open a large fish store, and a portion will be used to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.fr: Dorcas est une femme de 31 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants tous allant à l'école. elle possède un stand de vente de crédit de communication dans un quartier de la ville depuis 5 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des crédits de communication MTN et ORANGE afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses ventes.les profits générés vont être injectés dans son capital et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Dorcas, age 31, is the single mother of two children who both go to school. She runs a booth in a local district, where she has been selling mobile phone credits for 5 years. 

She is seeking a loan to buy MTN and ORANGE credits. This will help her to meet customer demand and to bolster her revenue. 

She will use her profits to strengthen her working capital and to provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone credits for resale.

loans.name: Jenga Group

texts.en:
Silvano is in his mid 20s and is single.  He has been selling fruit for five years.  He works from 6am to noon daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Silvano's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He wants to use the loan amount to buy popular fruit like mango and pineapple.  He dreams of building his own house.

Silvano will share this loan with his 7-member loan group "Jenga".  They will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy popular fruit like mango and  pineapple to resell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married with no children. Her husband is a farmer. She did not receive any formal education. Ama operates a provisions store in Abura, Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for about 2 years. As the sole breadwinner of the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions such as rice, milo, oil, groceries, etc. to improve her overall sales. With the new profit from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions such as rice, milo, oil, groceries, etc. to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells soft drinks in Abura, Cape Coast. She is married with no children. She has been in business for the past 6 years. Ekua uses her income to provide food, and to pay utility bills and other expenses for her family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks to expand her business, thus aiding her to control her overall expenses. Ekua has no formal education but she understands the importance of education to improve social conditions.  Therefore, she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her sisters' children remain in school and also build a better store for her provisions.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks to expand her business, thus aiding her to control her overall expenses.

loans.name: Azucar Y Canela Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento AZUCAR Y CANELA está compuesto por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis  son mujeres y dos varónes, que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es  la señora Guadalupe tiene 41 años tiene 2 hijos,   ella se dedica a  la elaboración y venta de chocolates con distintos  diseños,  ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante visitando distintas oficinas y ferias y mercados ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Guadalupe va a usar este préstamo para la compra de moldes para los diseños de los chocolates,  la señora Guadalupe va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos ya que esta época es donde tiene buena venta y de esta manera genera buenos ingresos,   se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Azucar y Canela communal bank comprise eight members, six women and two men, who do a variety of work. Guadalupe, 41, is the group's president  and has two children. She makes and sells chocolates of different types as a street vendor, going to offices, fairs, and markets to sell her merchandise. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. She will use the loan to buy molds to make chocolate designs. Guadalupe will use her profits to buy more supplies, since this is a great selling season, and she will be able to earn more money. She is pleased with and thankful for the opportunity the funding represents.

loans.use: to buy molds to make chocolates.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.fr: Nadia jeune femme de 25ans est revendeuse de pagnes de façon ambulante. Elle s'approvisionne à Lomé et son premier crédit octroyé à WAGES lui servira d'acheter des marchandises pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins des clients en cette période de fête de fin d'année. Elle a démarré en 2009 et espère devenir grossiste et fonder plus tard une famille.
texts.en:
Nadia, age 25, is an itinerant seller of pagnes. She buys her stock in Lomé, and she will use her first loan from WAGES to buy enough merchandise to meet customer demand over the new-year holiday season. 

She started her activity in 2009, and she hopes to become a wholesaler and start a family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, wigs, handbags, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and his four children, two of whom attend the public school. His dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life.

Shareef is asking Ryada for this loan. He will use it to paint his house and extend the plumbing. The loan will help him to take a step forward, because he has a shortage of money with which to buy the things he needs. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint his house and extend the plumbing

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is 47 years old and has three children. She operates a retail store where she sells cooking pans and stoves, which she has been doing for five years.  Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a permanent premise for her business. 

Benter is requesting a loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase cooking pans and stoves. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to rent a premise for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking pans and stoves

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 30-year-old married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil and other items.

She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a growing area and she has all types of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to increase her stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to invest more in her shop.

loans.use: to increase her stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a 28-year-old married man. He has two children aged 7 years and 11 years. He operates a carpentry business, making tables, chairs and other items. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate finances.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy timber for making furniture. His business goal is to be a major distributor within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will generate wealth for his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated earnings to invest more in his business and to pay the loan.

loans.use: to buy timber for making furniture

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La Señora Nancy sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y venta de comida,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos al por mayor para la elaboración de sus vestidos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mesas y sillas para mejorar la comodidad en su negocio, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer y  seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Nancy continues in the same work, which is preparing and selling food. She says that her previous loan turned out very well for her, as she used it to buy ingredients at wholesale prices to make her meals. This time she is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to make her establishment more comfortable. She is happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the opportunity they give her to grow and continue to improve her business, and therefore her income.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Marcela Filerma

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Abdón Calderón en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Marcela, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es maestro soldador y trabaja en la reparación de barcos.
Doña Marcela con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con estos pagar los estudios de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa  por catálogos y productos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra por semana o quincenas. También parte del crédito se lo da al marido para que compre materiales que el utiliza en su trabajo, el realiza arreglos de soldadura en varios barcos que llegan al muelle y que necesitan de reparaciones para continuar con sus faenas de pesca. Con estas actividades es como ellos salen adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, productos Avon, soldaduras y pinturas para el trabajo de su marido. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben con los créditos. Su sueño es tener un buen bazar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Mujeres Unidas" (United Women) meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Abdón Calderón in the city of Manta. This city is well-known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. It is also a city that is unequaled in its beauty and has many tourists attractions.

Sra. Marcela lives in this place. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children (ages 10 and 7) who are in school. Her husband is a master welder and works at a boat repair shop.

In order to have her own income and to pay for her children's education, Doña Marcela sells clothing through catalogs and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She sells by going door to door. Marcela offers her products on credit and then collects payments weekly or every 15 days. She will also give part of her loan to her husband so that he can buy materials for his work. He does welding on different boats that come to the dock in need of repairs so that they can return to their fishing jobs. Through these activities, Marcela and her husband are able to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, Avon products, as well as soldering supplies and paints for her husband's work. Marcela has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and she enjoys being a member because of the assistance she has received with the loans. Her dream is to have a successful bazaar.

loans.use: to buy clothing, Avon products, as well as soldering supplies and paints for her husband's work.

loans.name: Altanbagana

texts.en: Mr. Altanbagana is 23 years old and lives with his newly wedded wife in their Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt house in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife, Ulziidelger, works at local company.   Altanbagana was very interested in mechanics and automobiles as a kid. His father was a mechanic and provided auto repair services to local drivers and clients.  Altanbagana has helped him and learned from him. He started his own business of auto repair services in 2010, right after he graduated from college. He is a passionate and hardworking man, who needs 7,500,000MNT to purchase extra tools and equipment to start providing renovation and painting services at his workshop. He is now trying to increase his income since he has just started his own new family.

loans.use: to purchase extra tools and equipment to start providing renovation and painting services at his workshop.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Foad is 24 years old and lives in Gaza with his wife. He takes photos of weddings, birthdays, and any occasion that the customers want. This activity is his only income source. Foad asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy new video and photograph cameras to increase the number of clients and increase his income to improve the financial conditions for his family. Foad is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy new video and photograph cameras to increase the number of clients and increase his income.

loans.name: Luis Ecuador

texts.es:
LUIS  tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil uniòn libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y la convivienda en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los rìos.

Es Integrante de la VRC ANCHOVETA, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto Anchoveta Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo viejo se dedican a dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

LUIS se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, fertilizantes y abonos, una bomba para fumigar. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la bomba para fumigar los sembríos.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas . El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras y el clima.

El sueño es un negocio propio como una tienda de abarrotes y que atienda la conviviente. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Luis is thirty-nine years old. He lives in in a common-law marriage and has two children. He lives with his children and partner in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos Province. 

He is a member of the "Anchoveta" communal bank. It's located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, Recinto Anchoveta, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo Canton where the people work in agriculture and ranching. 

Luis works in agriculture; he grows corn, rice, and beans. He is applying for this loan to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, manure, and a sprayer for pesticide application. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and a pesticide sprayer to treat his fields.

He will make his purchases and sales in Ventanas. The challenges that he faces are soil pests and diseases as well as the climate. 

His dream is to own a small business such as a grocery store and take care of his partner. In his spare time, he likes to go on walks with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, and a pesticide sprayer.

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Alimamy.  He is married and has 2 children aged 6 and 2 years. One child attends school.

In 2011, Alimamy established his mobile phone and accessories business. He began his business because he dropped out of school (due to lack of sponsorship).  He joined his brother's business, who supplied him with patent medicines to be sold and paid back at a particular cost.  He was in the patent medicine business for some years and the commission he earned were used to start his own business. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 1,900,000 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Alimamy requires a loan to buy chargers, mobile phones, memory cards, phone screens, phone speakers and phone batteries.

Alimamy was not able to build a house or shop but he does improve his stock to meet demands.
This loan will help him to buy more stock and maximize profits.  He is an honest and trustworthy business man.  He thanks you and ARD for supporting his business.

loans.use: to buy chargers, mobile phones, memory cards, phone screens, phone speakers and phone batteries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 40-year-old, married woman. She has three children, with ages ranging from 13 years to 20 years. She operates a retail shop, where she sells drinks, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a competitive place, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is that suppliers are located far from her business.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more stock, including drinks, washing soap and other items that she sells. Her business goal is to have a mini-supermarket within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP-DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the loan and educate her children.

loans.use: to add more stock, including drinks, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 26-year-old, single man. He describes himself as honest and loyal. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is increasing fuel prices.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to increase his income within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be the best in the business. This is his first loan with SMEP-DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay for insurance.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba âgée de 45ans vit avec son conjoint et leurs enfants à Lomé. Pour prêter main forte à son mari, elle revend au marché des sacs et sachets plastiques. Son souhait est de développer son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille. A première demande faite à WAGES lui permettra d'acheter des sachets plastiques.
texts.en:
Ayaba, age 45, lives with her spouse and their children in Lomé. To help her husband, she sells plastic bags at the market. 

This first loan from WAGES will allow her to stock up on plastic bags. 

She wants to expand her activity and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags for resale.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil is a 34-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, parents and three children in the Marneuli district. His parents are provided with retirement pensions. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of land and grow potatoes and tomatoes. In addition, they have a cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. Adil works hard to have a good harvest which is sold to local retailers. Adil decided to start a poultry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3,000 to purchase hens. He will also purchase building materials to build a shed for hens. He will sell eggs and chicks locally and will generate more income. Adil awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase hens and build a shed

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is aged 35 years. She is the mother of four children. Her husband has owned a vegetable shop in a nearby town, for many years. Her husband offers seasonal vegetables to his customers. He opens his shop early in the morning and closes at evening. But nowadays, he gets finished for the day too early, after selling all the vegetables. He wants to increase the stock available on a daily basis, so that he could sell the maximum amount of vegetables, until evening comes. This would enable him to get a maximum reward, for his efforts.

Therefore, Shenaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to enable her husband to buy more seasonal vegetables than he has in the past.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, for the growth of the business.

loans.name: Eisas' Group

texts.en:
Eisas is 31 years old, and she lives in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is a mother of four children, all of whom are under her responsibility. To provide the family’s living, she and her husband have been in rice farming, and they work as paid laborers. They have been working like this for eleven years, and she can earn about 33,900 KHR per day.

Eisas has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles. She completely paid back the previous loans, which have helped her family to have enough food. Now, she is the leader of this group of two. She and her co-member are requesting loans of 1,300,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR, respectively. Eisas is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, and to pay for farm labor to help with the rice reaping and plowing. She hopes to expand her current business, for her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en: Samnang is 32 years old, and a mother of three children. She is a borrower from the Moung Russey district in the Battambang province. To feed the family, she and her husband have been in rice farming, and they have worked as paid workers for 15 years. She can earn around USD10 per day. She is a past client with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner) and she successfully paid them back and has helped her family’s condition improve. Now she is a group leader of five; all of them are applying for a loan of 6,200,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her portion to pay for reaping fees. She hopes that her rice will gain good crop yields to make her family’s income increase to build a better life.

loans.use: to pay for reaping fees.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 28-year-old woman, and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She stopped school in the 11th grade, and she has been managing her home affairs and business very well. Grace is married with three children aged 10 and 6 who are attending school and live at home. For the past two years she has been selling used clothing in the local market. The problem she faces is sometimes slow buying, but most of the time she realizes profit. She is asking for a loan to purchase more used clothing for her business. She hopes to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Nazra

texts.en: Nazra is a 46-year-old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been driving an auto rickshaw, which does not belong to him. With the help of savings he wants to buy new auto rickshaw, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy the new rickshaw. He wants to start driving, but is looking for a lump sum amount.  Therefore, Nazra requested a loan for her son, so he can buy and happily drive a new rickshaw.  Nazra hopes that now her son will be able to generate a constant income. Nazra is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado County.  She is 38 years old and married with four children, between the ages of seven and seventeen years old.  Over the past 2 years she has been running a local restaurant in her community.  One of the problems she faces is earning a small income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, pepper, fish, onions, and oil for her business. In the future she would like to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, fish, onion, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Dinora Guadalupe

texts.es: Dinora de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco más la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Dinora, 43, lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She is known in her neighborhood for her humility and dedication to work. She never gives up and has always dealt with challenges. She puts great effort and determination into running her store, where she sells basic household items like grains, milk, eggs, and rice. She is dedicated to her job and offers good service; therefore, her customers seek her out and prefer her merchandise.

Dinora needs to stock more merchandise to meet growing demand, but she lacks the money to do so. So she has applied for a loan to buy merchandise like grains, instant food items, candy, beverages, etc. She trusts in God that the loan she is requesting will be provided soon and that she will have no worries besides providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy grains, instant food items, candy, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene 2 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado la calle principal de donde ella reside, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles. La clienta quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones, shorts y todo los necesario para su negocio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The client lives with her life partner and two children in her own house. She makes her living selling clothes. She has had this business for 2 years, and it has given her a lot of experience that allows her to earn a better income.

The business is located on the main street where she lives. She has acquired a lot of customers, because people know that everything is of quality and at reasonable prices.

The client wants to make a new investment, but does not have enough capital to back her up. That is why she is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, pants, shorts and everything necessary for her business. She assures us that she will be able to repay the debt and also hopes that she will give her home financial security.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, t-shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is Abdulai, 36. He is married and has 2 children ages 8 and 9. Both of them go to school. He has one additional dependent who is fostered and lives with him. 

In 2009, Abdulai established his provisions business. He began his business because he did not attend school; he was only introduced to farming.  When he become an adult, he farmed on his own and the proceeds he got were used to start selling retail. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 2,580,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. Abdulai requires a loan to buy soft drinks, toothpaste, batteries, soap, etc. 

Abdulai has bought a piece of land; he hasn’t got the shop because of the high rentage cost, but he was able to buy a motorbike instead. His plan is to develop his piece of land and relocate his business in the Lorry Park.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, toothpaste, batteries, soap, etc.

loans.name: Camino A La Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Camino a la Esperanza está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar con exuberante vegetación, sus verdes campos  son producto de la agricultura, la arquitectura del sector es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Las socias se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y algunos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades,  pero siempre buscando el bienestar de sus familias ya que desean que sus hijos tengan mayores oportunidades de trabajo y se superen.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Dolores de Jesús, se encuentra desde hace 7 años en el grupo de crédito Camino a la Esperanza, grupo que le gusta ya que todas sus compañeras son amigas y solidarias, cada crédito le permite mejorar y crecer en su actividad económica. 
Ella tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 16 y 13 años  que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
Doña Dolores de Jesús se dedica a la crianza de animales, tiene cerdos, gallinas y ganado del cual  obtiene la leche y con esta fábrica quesos, también se dedica a la agricultura  que es solo para el consumo de su hogar. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y alimento para sus animales. Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Camino a la Esperanza” [“Path to Hope”] is made up of seven women who live in and around the parish of Santa Ana in Cuenca, which is known for its lush vegetation, green fields of crops, and its mix of old and modern architecture. The members work in agriculture and raising animals, and some work in the city in various jobs. The members are always looking out for their families’ wellbeing, and they want their children to have better employment opportunities and to better themselves.

Dolores de Jesús has been a member of this group for seven years now. She likes the group because all of the members are friends and support each other, and because each loan allows her to improve and grow her business. Dolores de Jesús is 55 years old. She is a single mother with two children, ages 16 and 13, who study at a school in the city. The house in which they live is their own. Dolores de Jesús works raising animals, such as pigs, chickens and cows. She makes cheese from the milk from the cows. She also grows some crops, but only enough for use in her home. She is requesting this loan to buy pigs and feed for her animals. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Maria Adilia

texts.es: Doña María Adilia, es una humilde señora que se apoya por medio de crédito que utiliza para invertir en telas, ya que ella es costurera y muchas veces no cuenta con la materia prima ni el efectivo para continuar con los encargos que le hacen, esto debido al incremento de los precios en la canasta básica que absorbe más el bolsillo hoy en día, ella es casada su esposo es albañil, ambos se apoyan para sobre vivir con los gastos del día a día en el hogar entre otros. La señora María solicita este crédito para invertir en yardas de telas, accesorios para vestidos, hilos y agujas.
texts.en:
Doña María Adilia is a humble woman who is need of support with this loan so that she can invest in fabrics. She is a seamstress, but there have been frequent times when she does not have materials in order to complete her outstanding orders. Due to the increased prices of today's household items, she has had to absorb the extra cost.

María is married and her husband is a bricklayer. They support one another with the daily living expenses and other costs. Sra. María is requesting this loan so that she can invest in yards of fabric, clothing accessories, thread, and needles.

loans.use: to buy fabric, clothing accessories, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 32-year-old, married man from a small village near Tulkarm City. He is a father of four sons. For the past five years, Mahmoud has been working in a small store selling carpets. It is the only one in his area. Mahmoud would like to improve his store and buy more products because the demand increases in the winter.  Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his store to sell. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to increase his sales and also his income.  Mahmoud appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products for his store to sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 54-year-old married man from Jenin city. He lives with his wife and nine kids, five sons and four daughters. For the past few years, Omar has been working at selling fruits and vegetables in the local market. He buys his products from local farmers. It is a good business and earns a good income but still needs some money to improve it.

Omar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables from the local farmers to resell. By taking this loan, Omar will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Omar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables from local farmers to resell

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Ola is a 23-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother of two young kids: a son and a daughter. For the past two years, Ola has been   raising bees. It is a good business and she earns a good income from selling honey. 

Ola took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to expand the farm and buy more beehives. By taking this loan, Ola will be able to increase her productivity and her income.

loans.use: to buy more beehives

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is a 42-year-old, married man from a small village near Tulkarm city. He is a father of five sons. They all attend school. 

Saleem opened a small park for children in the village and he has a small pool in it. It is a good business, especially in the summer. 

Saleem took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to do some maintenance for the pool and improve it. By taking this loan, Saleem will prepare the park for the summer. Saleem appears in the photo in his park.

loans.use: to do some maintenance for the park pool and improve it.

loans.name: Haja  I.

texts.en:
Haja is 29 years old, married, and has one child who attends school.
